Richmond.Abella Center:
Abella Center formerly International Marketplace and originally El Portal Shopping Center is a mixed-use city services, business, shopping center and housing village transit-oriented development that was formerly a mall in San Pablo, California.


== History ==


=== Origins ===
The mall opened in the 1960s anchored by a originally by Simon's Department store which later became Mervyn's[Mervyn's]] department store, HomeBase home improvement store and Safeway supermarket. The mall declined with the exit of Safeway in the 1990s, relocation of Mervyn's to the new Pinole Vista Shopping Center and the bankruptcy of and closure of Home Base stores.
